questions.text: Which of these clubs has Andy Cole of Blackburn NEVER played for?
questions.explanation:
He played for all.

	Andy Cole actually started at Arsenal before going to Newcastle, and then Manchester United.

questions.text: When Duncan Ferguson played for Rangers on September 18, 1993, against Aberdeen, what injury did he sustain?
questions.explanation:
Knee Ligament Damage.

	He had overstretched when trying to get on the end of a cross and damaged his knee ligaments.

questions.text: Robbie Fowler scored a hat-trick on October 30, 1993, against which team?
questions.explanation:
Southampton.

	He scored in the 14th, 29th, and 85th minute.

questions.text: Which country was Patrick Vieira born in?
questions.explanation:
Senegal.

	Patrick Vieira was actually born in Senegal. One of his parents was French and he could choose which country he wanted to play for. He chose France.

questions.text: Who scored France's first goal of the 1998 World Cup?
Matt Jansen joined Blackburn Rovers during the 1998-99 season. Which club was his first?
questions.explanation:
Carlisle United.

	Palace lost a great player when he moved to Rovers. He played 42 games for Carlisle, and 26 for Palace.

questions.text: What was Les Ferdinand's first team?
questions.explanation:
Queens Park Rangers.

	He scored 20 goals altogether for them.

The Imps.

	The nickname "The Saddlers", "The Iron", and "The Silkmen", belong to Walsall, Scunthorpe United, and Macclesfield Town respectively.

questions.text: Which year was Emerson Thome born?
questions.explanation:
1972.

	Emerson Thome was born on the March 30, 1972.

Sheffield.
